wikipedia_page.main: John Harold Rhodes VC DCM & Bar (17 May 1891 – 27 November 1917) was an English recipient of the Victoria Cross, the highest and most prestigious award for gallantry in the face of the enemy that can be awarded to British and Commonwealth forces.

response: * John Harold Rhodes (1891–1917), English recipient of the Victoria Cross

There is a monument to Coltman at the Memorial Gardens, Lichfield Street, Burton. The Coltman VC Peace Wood is at Mill Hill Lane, Winshill. In Tunstall a road has been named in honour of Coltman, along with roads named after John Harold Rhodes VC, and R. J. Mitchell, the designer of the Supermarine Spitfire, who were also from Staffordshire.
*John Harold Rhodes, English recipient of the Victoria Cross

Among the burials are Victoria Cross recipient John Harold Rhodes,Commonwealth War Graves Commission Edward Horner, a member of a prominent British aristocratic family, and Archie McMillan Scottish professional footballer.
*John Harold Rhodes (1891–1917), soldier awarded the Victoria Cross during World War I.
